clinical_study.brief_title: Integrated Intervention for Substance Abusers With Depressive Disorders
clinical_study.official_title: Integrated Intervention for Substance Abusers With Depressive Disorders

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Office of Research and Development

clinical_study.source: VA Office of Research and Development

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a randomized clinical trial comparing outcomes of Integrated Cognitive Behavioral Treatment plus standard medications for veterans with both substance use disorders, depressive disorders versus the most commonly administered form of therapy for substance use disorders and depression, Twelve Step Facilitation (AA/NA model) group treatment plus medications.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a randomized clinical trial comparing outcomes of Integrated Cognitive Behavioral Treatment plus standard medications for veterans with both substance use disorders, depressive disorders versus the most commonly administered form of therapy for substance use disorders and depression, Twelve Step Facilitation (AA/NA model) group treatment plus medications. Follow-up assessments were conducted at quarterly intervals for one year following treatment.

clinical_study.why_stopped: PI has been contacted numerous times for an update, with no response. ORD requested a close out of this project. 10/2011

primary_outcome.measure: Hamilton Depression Scale, Timeline Follow-back (substance measure)

intervention.description: Twelve Step Facilitation Therapy involves focusing on topics from 12-Step programs which support sobriety goals and personal growth.
Integrated Cognitive Behavioral Treatment involves focusing on thoughts, activities, and interactions with people related to depressive symptoms and/or substance use.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Veterans age 18 and older with alcohol, cannabinol, and/or stimulant dependence and independent mood disorders will be included.
Exclusion Criteria:
Psychotic disorders
